author: matt.nelson
content: i would argue a full node doesn't really need to serve the second bullet here - "full" node ideally means participating in consensus or following the chain with a rolling world state (but not every world state, like an archive node).

author: matt.nelson
content: old blocks, yes - as full nodes store the entire chain and needs to serve segments of it to their peers (or some section of it, as Besu and nethermind have options to drop some histroy today, using checkpointing).
